plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_letters
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 letter.
Password must contain at least %d letters.

plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_lowercase
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 lowercase letter.
Password must contain at least %d lowercase letters.

plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_nonletter
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 non-letter character.
Password must contain at least %d non-letter characters.

plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_numeric
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 numerical digit.
Password must contain at least %d numerical digits.

plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_symbols
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 special symbol.
Password must contain at least %d special symbols.

plurals.name: lockpassword_password_requires_uppercase
plurals.item: Password must contain at least 1 uppercase letter.
Password must contain at least %d uppercase letters.

plurals.name: show_dev_countdown
plurals.item: You are now %1$d step away from being a developer.
You are now %1$d steps away from being a developer.

Set My Location, screen unlock, credential storage lock

You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your phone, you need to type a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on. You can\'t decrypt your phone except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.\n\nEncryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data.
You need to set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
No lock screen PIN or password
Require a numeric PIN or password to decrypt your phone each time you power it on

Encryption was interrupted and can\'t complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible. \n\nTo resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you\'ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.
The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you\'ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times.
Charge your battery and try again.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1 % complete.
Plug in your charger and try again.

%1$s will be able to read all notifications posted by the system or any installed app, which may include personal information such as contact names and the text of messages sent to you. It will also be able to dismiss these notifications or touch action buttons within them.
